intro: Zephyranthes longifolia, commonly known as the rain lily, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically blooms after rainfall, hence its common name, and is often found in moist, open habitats such as prairies and woodlands. Zephyranthes longifolia is a bulbous perennial that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
